We want to identify undifferentiated headings that are in the incoming bib records and maintain the authority file with them, but not add URIs to the bibs that have these headings.

authority_control.title: Create report of headings with AACR2 abbreviations
Output unauthorized headings from Voyager table
Subject headings should only look at LCSH and name headings should only look at NAF

comments.body:
The examples below are related to Issue #18 "Deities, fictitious names, and legendary characters from LCSH to NAF." Fictitious names are part of NAF, but they used to be in LCSH. Some bib records have retained the cancelled LCSH control numbers in $0.

Bib 11199403
60010 ‡a Gale, Dorothy ‡c (Fictitious character) ‡0 http://id.loc.gov/authorities/subjects/sh99002589
(should be no2014026773)

Bib 10964730
60010‡a Eyre, Jane ‡c (Fictitious character) ‡v Drama. ‡0 http://id.loc.gov/authorities/subjects/sh2009125318
(should be no2015088908)

She was able to zip through the items that had 100 or less but this one with 600+ images is dragging--everything is slow to load, bulk edit, typing into the label field, etc. Im checking with the other folks in teams 1 and 2 to see if they are having problems as well. ill test it out, too.

marc_liberation.title: Set up a webhook listener for Alma bib record updates
Determine how holdings with no items behave in Alma
Develop a batch indexer for real-time availability in Alma
Investigate real-time availability indexing in Alma
Investigate partial bib record update functionality
Rake task to create SCSB full dump file and also index the incremental updates from then to now

comments.body:
Investigating with @mzelesky . 
Currently we have the partners full dump files on `bibdata-worker2:/data/scsb_full`.
1. We want to create a task to connect to the scsb ftp server and pull the latest full dump. (this is either one zipped file or the 2 zipped files we currently have in the `/data/scsb_full`. I will know that after I connect to the scsb ftp server.) 
2. We will look for the earliest timestamp of these 2 zipped files; use this date to run a second rake task to index the incremental updates from that date until now.

The requests gem depends on rails 5.1.0. we should update the gem to at least rails 5.2
https://github.com/pulibrary/requests/issues/537
@hackmastera an idea for this. I will see if I can get some decent feedback and suggestions from the Communications and Exhibitions folks in EOG.
@hackmastera. images re-uploaded and saved in google drive folder:  https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1TMvQrdxOrDeA0eTpQNCkh86z2veDWHLy

I have encountered this when attempting to invoke `db:drop` and `db:setup`, but for https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy. Prior to today (04/23), this was never required in my macOS environment (10.14.5).
revoked any other certs

> I suspect that this might be some database migration problem (the process currently maps record fields to XML elements).

I have spent further time attempting to diagnose this, but I'm afraid that I could not find the root cause. I did confirm that this exists in the database as expected:

```
MySQL [aspace_prod_db]> select id,agent_person_id from note where notes like '%Dr. Margaret Snyder was actively%';
+-------+-----------------+
| id    | agent_person_id |
+-------+-----------------+
| 13196 |            NULL |
| 13198 |            NULL |
| 31017 |             232 |
+-------+-----------------+
3 rows in set (0.043 sec)
```

The Agent Person record which is linked to here is the appropriate one (232). However, this still does not permit the value to be exported.

I have e-mailed the mailing list in order to try and resolve the bug. I am very sorry for the delay.
Thanks, @jrgriffiniii!

pulfalight.title: Implements indexing for <container> elements as nested Solr Documents
Implements a minimal HTML view for EAD collections and components
Implements JSON serialization for EAD collections
Draft interactive wireframes for each screen featured on PULFALight

comments.body:
Also, just to confirm, these are wireframes for the the desktop version, right? 
And will the ToC have the scroll bar like the one Trey had created a mockup of?
Here's a series view that shows what it will look like when you scroll: https://xd.adobe.com/view/3660a78e-6fda-4eaf-7db5-09e9e7700340-4051/
Thanks, @sdellis. It's still unclear to me from these wireframes that one can scroll the entire ToC while reviewing a component record?

**Feedback/Questions 4/23** from @faithc and @apferrar review of wireframes _Single Page View / List View / Expanded View?_ We like the location, but may need to user test the label. We know we don't like "Entire Finding Aid". _Do we need to provide downloadable PDFs?_ It would be much easier to allow people to print the SPV (with print CSS) vs. generating PDFs. _The Table of Contents feels "heavy" in the wireframes. Can we make the proportions more similar to the current site?_ We have some constraints when it comes to developing for both mobile and accessibility. We need to make it easy for users to select either A) the component label or B) the expand/collapse icon. We also need to increase both font and the spacing of the table. Here is the acceptance criteria we need to meet WCAG 2.1: 1. Target Size: [To be considered "Operable" the click target needs to be at least 44x44 pixels](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?showtechniques=144%2C1412#target-size). This is what [44x44 pixels](https://dummyimage.com/44x44/ffffff/000000.gif) looks like. This is a WCAG AAA requirement. We aim for AA compliance, so we don't legally have to comply, but it's what is recommended. 2. Legibility: WCAG has no Text Size requirement, but [requires that a user needs to be able to resize/scale text up to 200 times without losing any functionality or content to be "Perceptible"](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/?showtechniques=144%2C1412#resize-text). This will be interesting to see how things wrap and how the hierarchy is represented at these sizes. The common browser default is a font size of 16px. We can go smaller than that, but I would definitely bump up our current TOC item size which is 11px. One thing I can do is look at playing with the color/grayscale values since the "heaviness" seems to come from the deeper nested items being darker and higher contrast. Something like this might be more fitting:
i think it may be a combo of the color scheme and size.
crazy idea: what if the main page was a light grey and the ToC shades of white?

**Feedback 4/23** from @apferrar and @faithc 

- Collections w/o Hierarchy
	- How do people sort these components without a "root node"? Contents and Arrangement in the current site allows one to sort on flat collections.
- Contents Tab
	- Does this go to SPV when clicked? 
- Question: Has Yale/Mark Custer implemented the ArchivesSpace SPV PUI plugin?
- Enable easy toggling between Expanded and Focused Views
- Fixed TOC menu that scrolls with you, but is scrollable itself (most promising approach)
- Explore moving the TOC Expand/Collapse icons to the left (more conventional)
- "Add to Cart" vs. "Request this {container}": decision is to keep "Request this {container}"
